contentrichtext.text: {{unreferenced|date=September 2009}} A '''source''' or '''sender''' is one of the basic concepts of [[communication]] and [[information processing]]. Sources are objects which [[wikt:encode|encode]] [[message]] [[data]] and [[Transmission (telecommunications)|transmit]] the [[information]], via a [[channel (communications)|channel]], to one or more [[observation|observer]]s (or [[receiver (information theory)|receivers]]). In the strictest sense of the word, particularly in [[information theory]], a ''source'' is a process that generates message data that one would like to communicate, or reproduce as exactly as possible somewhere else in space or time. A source may be modelled as memoryless, [[ergodic]], [[Stationary process|stationary]], or [[stochastic]], in order of increasing generality. ==See also== *[[Common technical regulation]] *[[CALM M5]] {{telecomm-stub}} [[Category:Communication|Source]] [[Category:Information theory]] [[Category:Television terminology]] [[nn:avsendar]] [[pl:Nadawca]]
